<div class="intro" id="intro">
Hello, my name is Toqi Tahamid Sarker. I am currently working as a Research Assistant at Southern Illinois University, Carbondale, USA, pursuing a PhD in Computer Science under the guidance of <a href="https://www2.cs.siu.edu/~kahmed/">Dr. Khaled Ahmed</a>. I am a member of BASE, a research lab focusing on Big Data and Software Engineering at Southern Illinois University, Carbondale.

Prior to this, I worked as a research assistant at <a href="http://www.panacealab.org/">Panacea Lab</a> under the supervision of <a href="http://www.jmbanda.com/">Dr. Juan M. Banda</a> at Georgia State University, and published a paper in IEEE Big Data 2019.

I have a strong passion for applying deep learning techniques to address real-world challenges. I created a large-scale solar dataset with over 500,000 images to track solar events using deep learning. Furthermore, I achieved a top 17% ranking in <a href="https://www.kaggle.com/c/the-nature-conservancy-fisheries-monitoring">The Nature Conservancy Fisheries Monitoring</a> competition at Kaggle.

I also worked under the supervision of [Mr. Moin Mostakim](https://www.bracu.ac.bd/about/people/moin-mostakim) at BRAC University on a deep learning project as part of my undergraduate thesis requirement.

My **research interests** are:

* Object Detection/Tracking
* Computer Vision
* Applied Deep Learning
* Big Data Mining


Visit my [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=i1SmuwYAAAAJ&hl=en) profile to see my publications.
</div>
